page.title: 01VILLAGE IN THE FOREST
page.content: The whole block is owned by the Forestry Commission, abb to F.C. throughout the remainder. The Norfolk_ Suffolk County border follows the L. Ouse in a large curve in the north of this block; Santon Downham is at the centre of this arc. Here the administrative centre of the Thetford Forest has been built. This Forest is the largest lowland forest in Britain _21,483 Ha forest and 969 Ha farmland. It makes good use of the poor soil of Breckland. The F.C. was established in 1919 and planting of Scots pines started here in 1922. The trees are now Corsican pines which are found to be more economic. The Forest District Office also acts as a Fire Control Centre which is served by local fire brigades. Most of the following pages contain references to the F.C.
